results.title: The Work of Kew gardens
results.creator_credit: Helen Wiggins Films and A.E.C. Hopkins
results.brief_description: Documentary of all the collections of plants both living dead, the various research divisions and library (some of the matter is 500 years old). Special classrooms for diploma student gardeners, International research Department.

results.title: The Work of ice
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films and E F V A
results.brief_description: Some of the landforms associated with glacial erosion and deposition are shown in this film designed for school pupils aged 9-13. The French Alps, North Wales and East Yorkshire are depicted and the various landforms such as glaciers, moraines and aretes are explained.

results.title: The Work of director Spike Jonze
results.creator_credit: Palm Pictures, Vincent Landay, Richard Brown and Spike Jonze
results.brief_description: This DVD features the work of director Spike Jonze (“Being John Malkovich”,”Adaptation”) from video clips to short films. Before his current success directing feature films, Jonze specialised in directing humorous, inventive and slightly bizarre video clips, spanning a decade. Bands featured include: Wax, Beastie Boys, The Pharcyde, The Breeders, Daft punk, Fatlip, Weezer, Fatboy slim, Dinosaur Jr, and The Chemical Brothers. Some of the clips are quite inventive, playing to Jonzes sense of absurdity and irony. Jonzes short films are just delightful, especially Amarillo by morning; as are the rarities which include footage detailing the Oasis video that never happened and Rockafella Skunks audition tape for Fatboy Slim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Palm Pictures, Vincent Landay, Richard Brown and Spike Jonze

results.title: The Work of art
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: The National Gallery of Canada serves the Canadian public in many ways. This film tours the galleries in Ottawa where the national collection of old masters, as well as modern works, are on display. It shows how the Gallery helps foster art appreciation. Behind the scenes we see another phase of the work of art—the cleaning, preservation and storing of art treasures.

results.title: The Work of angels : the Book of Kells
results.creator_credit: Louis Lentin, Crescendo Concept, Muse Film and Television, Viz Ltd and Murray Grigor
results.brief_description: Created over 13 centuries ago, The Book of Kells, one of the great glories of Irish Art, ranks among the chief treasures of the Western World. This video tracks the turbulent history of the Irish masterpiece since its conception to its final resting place in the great library of Trinity College in Dublin. Through the imaginative use of high definition film, the secrets and intricacies of this great gospel of Colum Cille, declared by 12th century traveller Giraldus Cambrensis as the work not of men but of angels, are revealed in glorious colour detail.
results.title_for_label: The Work of angels : the Book of Kells

results.title: The Wordsworth country
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and Derek Mayne
results.brief_description: An introduction to the English Lake District as a background to the study of its literary personalities and especially of Wordsworth and his work. Scenes of Hawkeshead; the Grammar school and the poet’s desk; the village and a May Day Procession; the surrounding hills and lakes. Also of Coniston, Lake Windemere, Grassmere, Dove Cottage, Rydal, and many other places which formed a general background to much of Wordsworth’s work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and Derek Mayne

results.title: The Woodwinds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Explains that the woodwind instruments produce interesting and colorful sounds in bands and orchestras. Shows how woodwinds are held and played and explains the basic principle of sound production in these instruments. Includes demonstrations of the flute, fife, piccolo, clarinet, saxophone, oboe and bassoon.

group.title: Instruments of the band and orchestra

results.title: The Woodwind choir
results.brief_description: The individual tonal range and qualities of the various woodwind instruments used in a symphony orchestra, and the techniques of playing them, are demonstrated in this film. Compositions by Brahms, Mendelssohn, Rossini, von Weber, Beethoven, and Schumann are used to demonstrate the function of woodwind instruments in full orchestral setting.

results.title: The Woodcutter's son
results.creator_credit: Steve Thomas, Michael Cummins and Flying Carpet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family foibles”.
Part of the “Family foibles” series of documentaries about five Australian families. After being sent to jail for armed robbery aged seventeen, Allan’s family disowned him. Almost thirty years later, his father is dead and Allan, now reformed and a published poet and community centre volunteer, is seeking to rebuild his relationships with his mother and sister. He travels back to country Victoria, to the town of his youth, wondering which family he really belongs to - his substitute family of crims and street people who understand him or the biological family to whom he is a stranger. His journey of reconciliation is punctuated with his poems and the train trip from Melbourne to Shepparton is interwoven with reminiscences of past events. A study guide is available from http://www.roninfilms.com.au/related/2365104851-0.pdf
